page.title: 03Land Distribution Part 2
page.content: Standing on the bridge looking West towards Home Farm the river runs fairly fast and goes up and down according to the tides. The banks of the river are fairly shallow. Looking East of the bridge is Ford Place House.Ford Place used to have an oast house. By Ford Place is a strawberry field. Behind Ford Place house there used to be hop gardens which were pulled down 6 years ago. The field next to the bridge is growing barley. The biggest percentage of trees are oak. Along the river bank there are clusters of hawthorn. The fields opposite Penshurst school grow dandilions and buttercups.
